tips.title: AWS Image Detection
tips.line1: Image classification is the primary domain, in which deep neural networks play the most important role of medical
tips.line2: image analysis. The image classification accepts the given input images and produces output classification for identifying
tips.line3: whether the disease is present or not.

image.title: Image Classification
image.desc: With three steps, your input images are classfied. You can export AI models and use it in mobile devices or broswers. The Image classification is based on AWS technology.

step1.name: Step 1: Define Classes
step1.enterName: Enter the name of the class. Final result will be in one of the class
step1.s3BucketDesc: The Amazon S3 bucket that you want ML-Bot to store your access logs in.

step2.name: Step 2: Training
step2.time: The training process takes about 15 minutes

step3.name: Step 3: Preview and Export Result
step3.desc: The model training completed. You can preview the result
step3.chooseS3: Choose S3 bucket to export model
step3.ready: Enabled after predict service is ready.

step4.name: Step 4 (Optional): Setup this feature into your own AWS Account Info
step4.desc: Click the button to deploy a cloudformation stack into your own AWS account. You can upload images from S3 as input and output the result from your S3 bucket. All AWS resources are already setup for you within the template.

step5.name: Step 5 (Optional): Make API Call Info
step5.desc: By calling the API of this feature, you can don’t need to setup your own AWS resources, you can simply call the API from your code. Please see the pricing model for the detailed information.
step5.publicEndpoint: This is a public endpoint provided by AWS Solutions.
step5.exploreMore: Explore more Similar APIs (provided by AWS Partners
